comments:
I had created the file using the simple File->New->File action, then pasted the contents of another 
schema file into the source tab and made the appropriate edits. When I switched to the definition 
tab to have a look at the result, the following NPE occurred.

1) Can you reproduce this readily 
2) Can you attach the file that caused this to happen

Hi Dejan,

I was looking into this one and can reproduce it readily on Windows.  The NPE is
simply because the aggregate model does not exist when the editor is opened.

i.e. ISchema schema = (ISchema) editor.getAggregateModel(); returns a null schema.

I can get rid of the NPE with a null check but you'll still get the "The source
page has errors.  Other pages cannot be used until these errors are corrected."
dialog.

Note, of course, that there are no problems if you close and reopen the editor.

Is there a way to replenish the model/schema as if we reopened the editor?
Upon a synchronizeModelIfNeeded(), the schema input context will now attempt to create the schema if it did not exist.
